result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Patrick Kletschka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paul Patrick Kletschka is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Paul Patrick Kletschka was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Apply bond on file and refund balance to payor.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Patrick Kletschka

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Chelsea Anne Whitley   DF:  Paul Patrick Kletschka appeared. Case called at 2:01 p.m. ADA McKinley gives recommendations. Atty Whitley states defendant is agreeable to the offer. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 2 in 15CM341  . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CM341. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CM341. Sentencing arguments. Defendant makes a statement. Crt orders:

- Fine in the amount of $250.00 inclusive of costs. DNA Surcharge $200.00. Bond to apply and refund of the balance

- Provide DNA Sample
Filed by Atty Whitley. Requesting Plea Date on 8/20/2015. Hearing reset to 8/20/2015. km
Filed by Atty Whitley. Requesting a continuance of 7/13/2015 PTC. Hearing reset. km
Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Francis D. Collins,  Paul Patrick Kletschka pro se. Court confirms address. Court questions Defendant, he wishes to proceed without an attorney.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Court enters NG.  Reserves speedy trial.  Defendant would like to plea to Possession of Drug Para. and have bail jump dismissed, Court would like to continue and set for PTC.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
